notes: On 26 February 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, students of the Normal Rural de Ayotzinapa and parents of the 43 disappeared students held a rally and demonstrated in front of the anti-monument to the 43 to denounce the lack of progress in the investigation of the Ayotzinapa case. On 18 February 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, Distrito Federal, one woman and two men were shot and killed outside a house by two armed men in Colonia Lomas de Becerra. 3 fatalities.

notes: On 3 February 2021, Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, around 180 members of the Morena party protested in front of the party's national headquarters against an alliance with the Green Party and the Labor Party in the state of Veracruz ahead of the June elections. [size=around 180]

On 2 February 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, approximately 30 students of Nursing and Obstetrics at the National Polytechnic Institute (IPN) blocked the road of Circuito Interior around Manuel Carpio to protest against the re-election of the director of the campus. [size=approximately 30]

Around 31 January 2021 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, a group of street vendors attacked police officers and personnel of the Undersecretary of Mayoral Programs and Public Street Reorganization who were carrying out an operation to remove street vendors from the historic center. The rioters threw rocks and sticks at the police and one person reportedly fired several shots. An armed person was arrested and five police officers and three civilians were injured. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Venustiano Carranza, a group of nurses from the General Hospital of Balbuena demonstrated against the lack of staff, supplies and medicines to deal with the coronavirus. The demonstrators asked for support and to be able to have a break. [size=no report]
On 29 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, more than 100 cyclists blocked a road in Colonia Roma to demand justice for the death of cyclists in traffic accidents. [size=more than 100]

On 29 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, MORENA militants took over the party's headquarters located in Colonia Roma to demand the resignation of the national leader due to an alleged imposition of pre-candidates for the elections. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, relatives of prisoners marched to demand the courts' reopening to allow the trials of their relatives to take place. Due to the coronavirus, the activity of the courts was suspended on 7 December. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Coyoacan, around 30 workers in different unit of the Coyoacan mayor's office demonstrated to demand the January salary payment and to put an end to delays in payments. [size=around 30]

On 28 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, between 100 and 300 workers of the nightlife sector, bars and clubs demonstrated to demand the reopening of these establishments. The leisure industry has been shut down as part of coronavirus measures. [size=between 100 and 300]

On 27 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Iztapalapa, a man was shot dead in Colonia Banjidal by an armed man who fled in a car with his accomplice. Two men were arrested as suspected perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 26 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Tlahuac, a woman who had allegedly committed a robbery was about to be lynched by a group of people who tied her to a pole in Colonia Zapotitlan. The police released the woman. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, relatives and friends of inmates of different prisons in Mexico City protested to demand an inspection of jails in the capital since they have been unable to visit their relatives and know about the detention conditions. On 25 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, feminist groups and victims of violence protested in front of the facilities of the Mexico City Attorney General's Office (FGJ) to demand justice for those who have suffered violence and still have not obtained a judicial response. The protesters demanded the Mexican authorities justice for rapes and disappearances of women in the country. [size=no report]

On 25 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Alvaro Obregon, health workers of the Adolfo Lopez Mateos Regional Hospital of the Institute of Social Security and Services for State Workers (ISSSTE) blocked University Avenue to demand to be vaccinated against the coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Iztacalco, three men were abducted in Colonia Agricola Oriental. Two of the hostages were released in Chalco, while the third hostage was freed by police in Atitalaquia, Hidalgo. Four men were arrested during the police operation.

source: La Silla Rota; Tabasco Hoy; La Voz de Michoacan
notes: On 23 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Iztapalapa, a young boy was shot and killed by two armed young girls in a car (drive-by) in colonia Desarrollo Urbano Quetzalcoatl. Allegedly, after the attack the young girls also threatened the family of the young boy. 1 fatality.

On 22 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, a group of 50 indigenous people members of the Originals Indigenous Artisan Movement of Mexico protested and blocked a road to ask the federal authorities and the National Guard to intervene and curb insecurity in Oaxaca. The protesters demanded justice for the indigenous community of Copala as they argued that MULT paramilitaries are attacking the Triqui community. [size=50]

On 22 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, several cycling collectives gathered in Colonia Roma to protest and demand justice for the death of a cyclist hit by a car on January 21. [size=no report]

source: La Jornada; 24 Horas (Mexico); El Siglo de Durango; La Silla Rota
notes: On 22 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Benito Juarez, a man was shot and killed by two armed men who intercepted him after going out of a gym in Colonia Napoles. The bodyguard accompanying the victim who was an element of the Banking and Industrial Police (PBI) tried to repel the attack but he was also shot and killed. A woman who was a passer-by was also shot and injured. The victim was a the owner of a company that was investigated for money laundering. 2 fatalities.

On 21 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Venustiano Carranza, workers of different areas of the Venustiano Carranza mayor's office blocked the intersection of Eje 3 Oriente and Fray Servando Teresa de Mier in Colonia Jardin Balbuena to demand the payment of extra working hours. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, residents of the Municipality of Chimalhuacan protested around the National Palace to demand supplies and tests to detect the coronavirus. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Miguel Hidalgo, the police found 1.2 tons of cocaine inside an abandoned truck that had a car accident. The driver managed to run away. According to the authorities, the products may be related to the operations of the Sinaloa Cartel.
On 18 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Venustiano Carranza, an elderly woman was shot and killed by two armed men on a motorcycle (drive-by) in Colonia Nicolas Bravo. 1 fatality.
On 18 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Tlalpan, a former police officer was shot dead in front of his house by a pair of armed individuals in Colonia Nuevo Renacimiento. 1 fatality.

On 18 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, a group of people demonstrated in front of the Federal Electricity Commission (CFE) to denounce excessive charges on electricity. They demand the dismissal of the CFE director's following December power outages. The demonstrators burned their electricity bills, showed CFE officials' photographs and closed the central lanes of Reforma Avenue for several minutes. [size=no report]

Around 17 January 2021 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Venustiano Carranza, a man and a woman were killed and their bodies were found dismembered in two bags in Colonia 20 de Noviembre. The victims were cousins and merchants of Tepito. Both were found with gunshot wounds. The woman also had tape around her head. According to a report, they were allegedly victims of kidnapping and extortion. On January 20, a young man was arrested as a suspect. 2 fatalities.

On 16 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Miguel Hidalgo, during the early morning hours a man was shot dead by two armed men in Colonia Pensil Norte. According to the report, the victim is believed to be a street watcher for the Union Tepito gang. The attack may be related to an armed clash that occurred on 15 January in Colonia Anahuac. 1 fatality.

source: Diario de Morelos; El Siglo de Durango; La Verdad; Entorno Informativo; Tabasco Hoy
notes: On 15 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico - Miguel Hidalgo, five men were shot dead by six armed individuals in a house in Colonia Anahuac. One of the victims is an alleged leader of La Union Tepito gang. 5 fatalities.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 15 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, around 30 people of colonia Guadalupe Proletaria blocked the streets and protested to demand the closure of the Uribe Funeral crematorium due to the gases it emits. [size=around 30]

Around 14 January 2021 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, merchants of Tepito clashed with police officers after the police told the merchants to leave the area as part of coronavirus measures. One of the merchants, threw liquids at the police officers. The police responded with a hit and the clash started. The event was recorded on video and shared on social media. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico-Tlalpan, around 15 ISSSTE workers who were fired protested in front of the institute's headquarters and demanded their reinstatement and the payment of their salaries. [size=around 15]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero

According to the investigations, the perpetrators are part of the gang Los Malcriados 3AD. 1 fatality.

source: La Voz de Michoacan; El Proceso
notes: On 11 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico-Azcapotzalco, a woman was shot and killed and another man and a woman were injured by armed men in a car in a drive-by shooting. According to the report, the injured man had some drug problems. 1 fatality.

On 11 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico-Miguel Hidalgo, restaurant workers located on Presidente Masaryk Avenue in Colonia Polanco protested and carried out a pot banging protest to demand the opening of restaurants despite coronavirus measures. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, members of Morena party protested outside the offices against a Morena alliance with other parties candidates in the coming elections. [size=no report]

In addition, the company, stopped paying Infonavit and its contributions to the Mexican Institute of Social Security. [size=no report]

source: Diario de Morelos; La Silla Rota
notes: On 6 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico-Tlalpan, there was a clash between police officers and members of the Cartel de Tlahuac. Around 3 January 2021 (week of), in Ciudad de Mexico-Iztapalapa, a man was killed and his body was found wrapped in plastics and a blanket in the trunk of an abandoned car in Colonia Paraiso. Neighbors reported the abandoned car the week of January 3. 1 fatality.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 2 January 2021, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, a Ministerial Federal Police was shot and died in Colonia San Felipe de Jesus. 1 fatality.

On 30 December 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Iztapalapa, at least 30 medical personnel and administrative workers from eight hospitals as well as family members of the military protested in front of the Hospital of the Secretariat of National Defense (Sedena) to demand to be vaccinated against the coronavirus. assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Mexico); Mixe Indigenous Group (Mexico); Mazahua Indigenous Group (Mexico)
notes: On 16 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, indigenous Triqui (Mixe group) and Mazahua merchants demonstrated and intermittently blocked Pino Suarez Avenue to be allowed to sell in the historic centre. The demonstrators say that due to the coronavirus, their income has dropped. [size=no report]

source: Diario Contra Poder en Chiapas; Milenio
notes: On 16 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, approximately 50 sympathizers of Mexico's president threw firecrackers and tried to take down the tents of FRENA activists who are holding a sit-in in the Zocalo. The police intervened to disperse the rioters demanding the removal of the camp. [size=approximately 50]

Around 14 November 2020 (weekend of), in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, Teachers, directors and students of the Benemerita Universidad Autonoma de Puebla (BUAP) held a rally in front of the Senate to denounce that the state of Puebla is violating the autonomy of the university by subjecting it to recurrent inspection processes. [size=no report]

Around 14 November 2020 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico-Iztapalapa, a baby boy of two months was killed and his body was found wrapped in a blanket with signs of torture in Colonia Penon Viejo. According to the authorities, the baby had several hours dead. 1 fatality.

On 13 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, approximately 30 hooded women held a demonstration against the killing of a young woman and against gender-based violence in Colonia Doctores. The demonstrators entered the 'Inter Family Support Center' and started burning boxes with files. They painted the wall of the Local Prosecutor's offices and broke the windows of the 'Balderas' stop of the Metrobus line. The Atenea female police group intervened and clashed with the demonstrators. No injuries reported. [size=approximately 30]

On 13 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Iztacalco, nearly 80 friends and family members of a 13-year-old missing girl since November 3 marched on Eje Central avenue to demand support from the authorities to find the girl. [size=nearly 80]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 13 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, 20 hooded people with knives took over the facilities of the High School No. 9 in Colonia Lindavista. They threatened school workers and took over the facilities. They said that they protested against the lack of concession made to their demands. Exact motive of the demonstration unknown. [size=20]

On 12 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, residents of Chimalhuacan held a protest to demand housing supports. Another group protested in front of the Secretary of Agrarian, Territorial and Urban Development (Sedatu) on Paseo de la Reforma avenue where they organized a human chain. [size=no report]

On 12 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, friends of the young boy who was found dead on November 11 in Colonia Guerrero marched in Eduardo Molina Avenue to demand justice. [size=no report]

On 12 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Benito Juarez, family members of victims of femicides protested in front of the offices of the National Commission to Prevent and Eradicate Violence against Women (Conavim) to demand justice for victims of femicides and the streamlining of investigation procedures. [size=no report]

source: Independiente de Hidalgo; La Verdad; Tiempo
notes: Around 11 November 2020 (from 10 -11 November), in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, a young boy was killed and his body was found inside a suitcase in Colonia Guerrero. Two young boys were arrested after being identified by a security camera where they were seen taking the suitcase. The victim was kidnapped on November 10 by four members of La Union Tepito in Colonia 20 de Noviembre. The perpetrators asked for money to the family but the money was not paid. The body was found on November 11. 1 fatality.

source: El Siglo de Durango; La Silla Rota
notes: On 11 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, a group of 25 women of feminist collectives gathered and protested against police repression during a protest against the feminicide of a woman in Cancun days before. Other groups protested in different locations in Colonia Roma. [size=25]

On 11 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, members of the Mexican Union of Electricians (SME) and the National Alliance of Electric Power Users (ANUEE) protested in the Zocalo to demand labour reintegration of CFE workers. [size=no report]

On 11 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, family members and friends of a cyclist who was run over on November 6 protested in Insurgentes. The Mobility secretary (Semovi) promised to cover medical expenses but has not done so to date. [size=no report]

On 10 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, a young man was killed and his body was found with signs of torture, burned and with his head inside a plastic bag in a house in Colonia Morelos. According to the neighbours the house is known as a drug-selling point. The neighbours saw how the young man was forced into the house that morning. According to the authorities, the area is controlled by La Union Tepito and this event is a possible settling of accounts for the control of the sale of drugs. 1 fatality.

On 10 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Tlalpan, police responding to a report of a buried body were shot by the alleged perpetrators of the killing. The victim was allegedly kidnapped and killed after her family failed to pay for her ransom. No injuries were reported and several people were arrested.

On 10 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, relatives of a man who disappeared after being admitted to a hospital in Xoco demonstrated to demand the activation of a search protocol for missing people. [size=no report]

Around 10 November 2020 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico-Tlalpan, a woman was killed and her buried body was found in San Miguel Topilejo. According to the report the woman was kidnapped and was killed after her relatives failed to pay for her ransom. During the operation to locate the woman, the police were shot by the alleged kidnappers and several people were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 10 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Venustiano Carranza, the house of a federal deputy was shot in Colonia 10 de Mayo. Bullets and shooting holes were found. There was no fatalities or injuries reported.

assoc_actor_1: CNTE: National Coordination of Education Workers; Teachers (Mexico)
notes: On 9 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, CNTE members demonstrated outside the National Palace and made a human chain to demand the hiring of all teachers that were previously dismissed as a result of the labor reform promoted by the former president of Mexico. They further demanded the punctual payment of salaries. [size=no report]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 8 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, 30 women demonstrated near the National Polytechnic Institute (IPN) to denounce cases of harassment and sexual assault against students at the institute. The demonstrators intended to take over the IPN building in the Zacatenco Unit but were prevented from doing so by the police. Demonstrators claim they were beaten by the police. [size=30]

On 6 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, at least 7 parents of 49 children who died during a fire at a nursery school in 2009, entered the headquarters of the Ministry of the Interior and started a sit-in to ask for justice for the death of their children. [size=at least 7]
On 6 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Azcapotzalco, a man was shot dead by two armed individuals in Colonia San Miguel Amatla. It appears that the victim was an alleged thief. 1 fatality.

On 5 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Benito Juarez, approximately 30 UNAM graduate students marched to the Conacyt offices to protest against the suspension of scholarships offered by the institution. [size=approximately 30]

On 5 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Tlalpan, as part of a demonstration organized by relatives and friends to demand the finding of a missing student, a group of 20 hooded individuals destroyed a UNAM security patrol and took over the facilities of Jose Vasconcelos High School 5. [size=20]

On 5 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, a group of teachers from Tabasco began a sit-in near the National Palace to ask to meet with representatives of the federal government. Their demands include the hiring of 10 teachers who were dismissed. [size=no report]

On 5 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Coyoacan, approximately 20 transporters of the National Association in the Representation of the Motor Transport carried out a mobilization to ask the Secretary of Communications and Transport to speed up the procedures to obtain registration plates for transport units. Due to the coronavirus, the service was suspended and after being reactivated, pending procedures have not been processed yet. [size=approximately 20]

On 5 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Tlalpan, National Guard officers intervened to free the toll on the Mexico-Cuernavaca highway that was taken over by a group of people as part of a protest. After being released, hooded people tried to retake the toll but the National Guard prevented them from doing so. [size=no report]
On 5 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Venustiano Carranza, about 100 merchants blocked the Circuito Interior at Oriente 35. The reason for the protest is unknown. [size=about 100]
On 5 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, members of different groups demonstrated in front of the Legislative Palace against cuts included in the Federal Budget for 2021. [size=no report]

On 4 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, a man and a woman were shot and injured in the area of Tepito by an armed man who fled with his accomplice. The attack appears to be revenge for the death of the perpetrator's mother who was allegedly killed for not paying an extortion. The perpetrator and two other people were arrested. 2 injured.

On 4 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, women members of the National Front for Sorority protested outside the Senate in support of the so-called ''Olympia Law'', which recognize digital violence and punish crimes that violate people's sexual privacy through digital media. [size=no report]

On 3 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Coyoacan, workers of the Coyoacan mayor's office blocked the Miguel Angel de Quevedo avenue to demand the payment for their extra working hours. Since they work in the hydraulic service, they have not stopped working despite the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 3 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, workers of the National Institute of Fine Arts and Literature (INBAL) protested due to the lack of pending payments and demanded equal employment and salaries. They blocked part of Reforma Avenue. [size=no report]

source: La Verdad; La Silla Rota; Tabasco Hoy
notes: Around 3 November 2020 (as reported), in Ciudad de Mexico - Cuauhtemoc, Distrito Federal, two young boys were killed and their bodies were found with signs of torture and dismembered in black bags. The bodies were found as a member of La Union Tepito was taking the bodies out in his stroller wheeler in the city center. The boys were part of Mazahua Indigenous families. On 19 February 2021, six people were arrested. 2 fatalities.

On 3 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, parents of the 49 children who died in a fire in the kindergarten ''ABC'' protested in front of the Government Secretary to demand to be attended by the undersecretary. They asked for justice for the death of their children. [size=no report]

On 3 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Venustiano Carranza, at least 500 workers from the Interjet airline blocked the Terminal 1 of the International Airport to protest against the lack of payment and overdue benefits. [size=at least 500]

On 2 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, people of non-governmental organizations and activists marched and placed offerings to demand justice for the victims of homicide and missing women in the country. The march was from Hemiciclo a Juarez to Bellas Artes. [size=no report]

On 1 November 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Xochimilco, around 200 people from the ''Mexico Republicano'' movement held a car caravan to support the US President Donald Trump in the 2020 elections. The rally was called ''Republican Rally''. [size=around 200]

On 29 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, around 100 members of the Torch Movement from Chimalhuacan protested in front of the National Palace to demand that the federal government support subsidies for housing. [size=around 100]

On 29 October 2020, in Benito Juarez, Ciudad de Mexico, doctors of the Regional Hospital Number 1 'Dr Carlos MacGregor Sanchez Navarro' protested against the lack of supplies and equipment to attend coronavirus patients. [size=no report]

On 29 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, people protested outside the Senate of the Republic against the reduction of the Health Fund for Welfare. The protesters claim that the cut will be sufficient for vaccines against coronavirus but not for treatments of HIV patients. The protesters threw eggs in the yard of the Senate. [size=no report]

On 29 October 2020, in Alvaro Obregon, Ciudad de Mexico, a man was held and attacked by several residents of Colonia San Angel Inn after he entered the pantheon to steal objects such as crosses, images and ornaments. He was later taken by the Police. [size=several]
On 29 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, a woman was shot and killed by two armed men on a motorcycle (drive-by) in Colonia Roma. 1 fatality.

On 29 October 2020, in Benito Juarez, Ciudad de Mexico, residents blocked the intersection of Cuauhtemoc Avenue and Eje 7 Sur Emiliano Zapata in Colonia Santa Cruz Atoyac to protest against the expansion works of Line 3 of the Metrobus. [size=no report]

On 29 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, workers of popular fairs of the 16 municipalities of Mexico City blocked the San Antonio Abad road in Colonia Obrera to demand to be allowed to resume activities that were suspended during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
source: Tabasco Hoy; La Prensa de Monclova
notes: On 28 October 2020, in Gustavo A. Madero, Ciudad de Mexico, dozens of hooded students who called themselves 'Rebeldia Negra and/or Union de Estudiantes Disidentes' took over the facilities of the Colegio de Bachilleres (Colbach) in demand for actions against gender violence and improvements for online class conditions. They destroyed the facilities and burned paperwork and a truck. [size=dozens]

On 28 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, residents from Colonia Ampliacion Selene in Tlahuac blocked access to the offices of the Mexico City Water System (Sacmex) to demand improvements in the supply of water. [size=no report]

On 28 October 2020, in Coyoacan, Ciudad de Mexico, a group of hooded people took over the facilities of the 'Ricardo Flores Magon' (CECyT) 13 of the National Polytechnic Institute. The rioters caused damage to the furniture and graffiti sprayed some walls with messages against the education system. [size=no report]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 27 October 2020, in Gustavo A. Madero area of Mexico City, a group of hooded people entered the campus of Bachilleres number 9 and placed a barricade at the main entrance of the center located in Colonia San Juan de Aragon. Motive of the protest unknown. [size=no report]

On 27 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, a man was shot dead in Colonia Morelos. The victim is the son of an alleged Union Tepito Gang member. One of the perpetrators was arrested. 1 fatality.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 27 October 2020, in Gustavo A. Madero area of Mexico City, administrative personnel, doctors and nurses from La Villa Pediatric Hospital blocked Cantera Avenue in Colonia Martin Carrera to demand the dismissal of the centre's director, whom they accuse of mistreatment and harassment at work. The demonstrators who set up tents also showed their support for a doctor who began a hunger strike to demand that demonstrators be not sanctioned for their activism. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) Ministerial Federal Police; Police Forces of Mexico (2018-) National Guard; Military Forces of Mexico (2018-)
source: Imagen del Golfo; Independiente de Hidalgo
notes: Around 26 October 2020 (week ok), in Iztapalapa area of Mexico City, in a joint operation between the Attorney General's Office, the Ministry of the Navy, the Ministry of Defense, the Ministry of Security, the National Guard and the National Intelligence Center, as well as Mexican Customs, a fentanyl and methamphetamine lab was located.

On 26 October 2020, Benito Juarez area of Mexico City, a hundred relatives of the 43 disappeared students of Ayotzinapa protested in front of the anti-monument to denounce that after six years of the disappearance, little progress has been made in the investigation. [size=a hundred]

On 26 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, members of the National Union of Buses Mexico-Toluca, Zinacantepec and Ramales blocked the Paseo de la Reforma with Bucareli Avenue to denounce unfair dismissals and to demand freedom of association. They also asked to be included into the so-called word credits to face the coronavirus pandemic. They denounced that they cannot renew their licenses since the Secretary of Communications and Transportation is closed. [size=no report]

On 26 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, members of the Zapata Vive Movement set up a sit-in in front of the Attorney General's office to demand the release of a woman who was unfairly detained, according to the protesters. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of Mexico (2018-); Former Police Forces of Mexico (2018-)
notes: On 26 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, around 200 active and retired police officers members of the Vanguard Executive Committee demonstrated against the proposal to transfer their collective savings and loans to the government of Mexico City. [size=around 200]

On 26 October 2020, in Iztapalapa area of Mexico City, relatives and friends of a woman who disappeared on 18 October and was found on 25 October held a march and blocked the sides of the Ignacio Zaragoza Street to demand information about the case. [size=no report]
On 25 October 2020, in Magdalena Contreras area of Mexico City, a man was shot and injured by two armed individuals in Colonia San Bernabe Ocotoepec.

On 24 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, 400 people marched in favour of the Mexican president and the National Development Plan 2019-2024. The protesters are members of the National Front of the Fourth Transformation, Citizens in Defense of the People and the Organization 'Excalibur. La Razon y La Verdad' (Excalibur. Reason and Truth). [size=400]

On 23 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, between 15 and 30 hooded women belonging to the Union of Dissident Students of the Colegio Bachilleres and the Colectivo Rebeldia Negra took over the central offices of the Colegio de Bachilleres. The demonstrators demonstrated against sexual abuses and demanded the implementation of tools for online work, psychological support or the reform of the general regulations of the Colegio de Bachilleres. [size=between 15 and 30]

assoc_actor_1: FAC: Authentic Countryside Front; UNTA: National Union of Agricultural Workers; Farmers (Mexico); CIOAC-JDLD: Independent Central of Agricultural and Peasants Workers
notes: On 23 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, members of UNTA, CIOAC and the FAC marched to demand the authorities to establish a dialogue table over the rights to access water resources and to ask for the resignation of several officials. [size=no report]

On 23 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, a group of members of the Coordination of Students of UPN and Normal (CEUN) demonstrated and installed a sit-in on Seminario Street to demand an increase in enrolment and automatic work placements for graduates. [size=no report]

On 22 October 2020, in Venustiano Carranza area of Mexico City, about 30 former workers of the interjet airline demonstrated in the airline offices located in Terminal 1 of the airport to denounce that they were unjustifiably dismissed during the coronavirus pandemic and to demand their severance pay. [size=about 30]
On 22 October 2020, in Benito Juarez area of Mexico City, nearly 70 people demonstrated to prevent construction works to extend Line 3 of the Metrobus. [size=nearly 70]

assoc_actor_1: FAC: Authentic Countryside Front; UNTA: National Union of Agricultural Workers; Farmers (Mexico); CIOAC-JDLD: Independent Central of Agricultural and Peasants Workers; MST: Social Movement for the Earth; CODUC: Democratic, Urban and Farming Organizations Coalition
notes: On 21 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, members of UNTA, CIOAC, MST, CODUC and the FAC began a day of protests to demand the authorities to establish a dialogue table over the right to access water resources and to ask for the resignation of several officials. As part of the protest, they blocked the access to the building of the Governor's Office and protested in front of the Sedatu, the Inpi and the Conagua. [size=no report]

On 20 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, people blocked the entrance of the Senate of the Republic to protest against the cancellation of trust funds that have been supporting different branches and causes. [size=no report]
On 16 October 2020, in Iztacalco, Ciudad de Mexico, a man was shot and killed by two men on a moving motorcycle in Colonia Gabriel Ramos Millan (drive-by). 1 fatality.

assoc_actor_1: MTS: Socialist Workers Movement; Labour Group (Mexico); Movement for Our Disappeared in Mexico
notes: On 16 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, the MTS: Socialist Workers Movement, Movement for Our Disappeared in Mexico and other social organizations staged a demonstration to demand a higher budget to provide social benefits to Mexican people. People demanded new strategies and decent treatments programs for coronavirus patients. [size=no report]

On 15 October 2020, in Coyaocan, Ciudad de Mexico, students and members of feminist organizations staged a march on campus against gender based violence and sexual assaults on female students. [size=no report]

On 15 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, more than 50 women staged a demonstration in front of the Superior Tribunal for Justice against gender based violence and femicides in Colonia Doctores. [size=more than 50]

On 15 October 2020, in Ciudad de Mexico-Venustiano Carranza, Ciudad de Mexico, 20 women staged a demonstration against gender based violence and femicides in front of Congress and painted and broke windows. [size=20]

On 15 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, around 200 members of the FRENA: National Front Against AMLO staged a demonstration in front of the Senate of the Republic against the elimination of trust funds by PAN party members. [size=around 200]
On 15 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, neighbors staged a demonstration after their water was cut off in Colonia Buenos Aires. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_1: EZLN: Zapatista Army of National Liberation
notes: On 15 October 2020, in Tlalpan, Ciudad de Mexico, some 200 people and alleged members of the EZLN took the toll booth on the highway Mexico-Cuernavaca and charged drivers to pass through. [size=some 200]

On 14 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, people with mortgage loans and the Azteca Street Vendors Organization marched towards banking and financial institutions to demand that the end of street vendors evictions. [size=no report]

On 13 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, mathematicians, victims of violence, scientists and merchant sailors blocked all accesses to the headquarters of the Senate of the Republic against the plan to suppress the 109 trusts funds. [size=no report]

On 12 October 2020, in Benito Juarez, Ciudad de Mexico, around 50 people from the United Workers Coordination movement took over the facilities of the Ministry of Labor in Colonia Narvarte where they set up tents to start a sit-in to protest against layoffs in federal agencies. [size=around 50]

On 12 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, around 260 members of the National Taxi Movement (MNT) gathered at the Angel of Independence to staged a protest. The motive of the protest in unknown. [size=around 260]

On 12 October 2020, in Benito Juarez area of Mexico City, a group of Otomi indigenous people took over the facilities of the National Institute of Indigenous Peoples. They demanded the right to a dignified life and labor opportunities. [size=no report]

On 12 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, a group of independent artists gathered in the Glorieta de Colon on Christopher Columbus day to protest against the colonization of the Mexico 500 years ago. They gathered on the pedestal of a statue of Christopher Columbus that was removed earlier to avoid artistic intervention and damages to the monument. [size=no report]

On 11 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, supporters of the Mexican President tried to jump over the metal fence and set off smoke to the camping sit-in area of FRENA members. FRENA members responded by throwing smoke bombs back. No injuries or fatalities were reported. The event took place in the context of a sit-in set by FRENA in front of the governmental palace to demonstrate against the president. [size=no report]

On 11 October 2020, in Xochimilco, Ciudad de Mexico, approximately 50 people protested after the Head of Government of Mexico City visited the San Gregorio Atlapulco. They pointed out that mobility was poorly planned and that other problems such as the hydraulic network, paving, and the fixing of buildings damaged in the 2017 earthquake need to be done. [size=approximately 50]

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Mexico); SME: Mexican Electrical Workers Union
notes: On 10 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, members of the SME: Mexican Electrical Workers Union and retired people staged a march to the offices of the Secretary of Government demanding the provision of electricity services and the stepping down of the current head of the Commission for Federal Electricity. [size=no report]

On 10 October 2020, in Miguel Hidalgo, Ciudad de Mexico, dozens of women and members of feminist organizations staged a demonstration demanding justice after a student was raped on campus. [size=dozens]

On 8 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, around 200 employees of Uber Eats, Food, Rappi, Ivoy and Didi demonstrated close to the Angel of Independence against exploitation and demanded the guaranteeing of their labor rights. People complained about the lack of security guaranteed to couriers amid the coronavirus pandemic. [size=around 200]

On 8 October 2020, in Coyoacan, Ciudad de Mexico, former employees and employees of the mayor demonstrated against irregular working hours and the sudden termination of contract of 50 former employees who refused to work outside fixed working hours. [size=no report]

On 8 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, almost 400 workers who depend on the beach area of Acapulco demonstrated against the privatization of the maritime zone in Acapulco. [size=almost 400]

On 7 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, dozens of taxi drivers staged a demonstration in front of the Congress against the newly adopted Mobility Law. Taxi drivers complained that the new law only benefits digital platforms. [size=dozens]

On 7 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, a group of women staged a demonstration in front of the Senate against a recent decision to cut trust funds that were offered to family members of disappeared people in Mexico. Family members complained that they had been excluded from the decision-making process. [size=no report]

On 7 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, members of different organizations staged a demonstration in front of the controller's office of the capital against the construction of a bridge in a natural protected area of the city. [size=no report]

source: La Silla Rota; El Norte; Milenio
notes: On 6 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, around 100 members of organizations that advocate for the defense of victims protested rejecting a proposal that intends to suspend 109 trust funds and affect the operations of different social organizations. [size=around 100]
On 6 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, craft-makers members of the Mazahua indigenous group protested demanding financial support and access to housing aids. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, street vendors protested demanding financial support following losses caused by the coronavirus pandemic and the continuous closure of roads and areas of the city center. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, workers of the General Attorney's Office protested against unjustified dismissal and relocations. According to the participants, special authorizations for population at risk were not granted to workers that require additional precaution to avoid coronavirus contagions. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, members of the National Torch Movement protested demanding the installation of energy infrastructure and cheap rates for Tlahuac and Valle del Chalco municipalities. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, residents of Ejido Buenavista protested demanding the payment of compensation for the lands that were taken for the construction of a train that connects to Toluca municipality. [size=no report]

On 5 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, members of the organization Peaceful Civic Resistance marched to the National Palace to deliver a document in which they clarified the facts that occurred during a demonstration that turned violent at the Piramides toll on 1 October. The participants claimed that they are not responsible for attacks that were perpetrated during the demonstration. [size=no report]

On 3 October 2020, in Iztapalapa area of Mexico City, two armed individuals shot at people who were attending in a market stall. A man and a woman died and another man was injured. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.

On 2 October 2020, in Azcapotzalco area of Mexico City, armed individuals in three vehicles opened fire and shoot people who were eating in a restaurant in a drive-by incident in Colonia Providencia. At least 6 people died and 10 were injured.

On 2 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, a group of FRENA members marched from the monument to the revolution to the Zocalo, where members of the same group were staging a sit-in. The protesters demanded the resignation of the president of Mexico. [size=no report]

source: La Jornada; La Verdad; La Silla Rota; El Proceso
notes: On 2 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, coinciding with the 52nd anniversary of the Tlatelolco student killings, a group of 70 to 500 anarchists that organized a commemorative march clashed with the police using Molotov cocktails. 6 people were injured among them 2 journalist and 4 police officers. [size= 70-500]

On 1 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, a group of people demonstrated in front of the Chamber of Deputies to protest against the possible disappearance of trust funds that provide financial support to victims of human right violations. 12 demonstrators were authorized to enter the facilities to express their demands. [size=at least 12]

On 1 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, a group students and teachers from the Center of Research and Advanced Studies demonstrated in front of the Chamber of Deputies to protest against the cancellation of trust funds for science and technology research. [size=no report]

On 1 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, a man and a woman were shot and injured by an armed men in Colonia Morelos. Apparently the attack is connected to extortion. Both victims were merchants. 2 injured.

On 1 October 2020, in Cuauhtemoc area of Mexico City, dozens of people demonstrated in front of the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation to ask for a vote in favour of holding a consultation to prosecute the former Mexican presidents. [size=dozens]

Protesters also demanded the payment of bonuses, benefits and salaries, as well as the allocation of places for graduates of normal schools. [size=no report]

On 30 September 2020, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, a group of taxi drivers protested demanding financial aids that were promised by the government to reactivate the economy in light of the crisis caused by the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 8 October 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, Distrito Federal, a group of merchants and settlers beat, stripped, and tied a man to a pole who allegedly robbed passengers on a bus. The man was rescued by the Police. [size=no report]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 8 October 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, Distrito Federal, at least two individuals participated in the kidnapping of a man in Colonia Siete de Julio. Police officers rescued the victim and took the suspects into custody.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 8 October 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, Distrito Federal, merchants and elements of the Grenadier Group of the Ministry of Public Security clashed in front of the Basilica of Guadalupe due to an operation carried out by the Institute of Administrative Verification to recover 98 posts and place activity suspension stamps. The merchants claimed to be the legitimate owners of the establishments, so they tried to avoid the operation, and in the face of resistance, the grenadiers intervened to disperse demonstrators. [size=no report]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 7 October 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, Distrito Federal, the lifeless body of a homeless man was found inside a pipe. The victim had head injuries, allegedly caused by a stabbing weapon, and had a bow tied around his neck and hands.

On 6 October 2018, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, the body of a man was found wrapped in a plastic bag in Paraguay street. The details, motive and perpetrators behind the killing are still unknown. 1 fatality.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 6 October 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, Distrito Federal, a man was shot to death and one more was injured by unknown attackers in Colonia Loma La Palma. The place where the event occurred is known as a drug selling point.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 5 October 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, Distrito Federal, a lifeless body was found with plastic bags on the head and hands tied with a wire in Colonia Lomas La Palma. The identities of the victim and the attackers are unknown.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 4 October 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Gustavo A. Madero, Distrito Federal, a person walking on Teoloyucan-Chalmita Avenue and Teoloyucan Return was killed in a drive-by shooting by subjects traveling on a motorcycle.

On 3 October 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Azcapotzalco, Distrito Federal, students tried to remove barricades to access the college of Sciences (CCH). Hooded demonstrators also threw Molotov bombs against the Congress and objects against other buildings. [size=no report]

On October 2018 in Ciudad de Mexico-Coyoacan (Distrito Federal), an alleged thief was caught, tied up and beaten by a mob consisting of local merchants. [size=no report].

On 18 September 2018, in Cuauhtemoc, Mexico City, some 100 police officers evicted an indigenous group (Otomi) of 100 families from a neighbourhood in Colonia Juarez who had been living in the location more than 20 years. People denounced that the police arrived with men in civilian clothing who stole belongings and money from residents and used violence. There was no judicial warrant for the eviction. The action of the police turned into a clash: people used stones and sticks to reclaim the land. Dozens of people were injured. [size=some 100]

On 4 May 2018, in Iztapalapa, Ciudad de Mexico, Distrito Federal, the police clashed with drug traffickers in Presidente neighbourhood. Two members of the unidentified group and one member of the police forces died as a result of the shootout; two people were arrested and the police seized a gun and drugs. 3 fatalities.
On 4 May 2018, a police agent was found dead in Tlahuac (Ciudad de Mexico) in a car, with several wounds to the head and face. He disappeared on May 2. 1 fatality.

On 4 May 2018, the persons affected by the September 2017 earthquake marched in Centro Historico, Ciudad de Mexico to demand that the real estate company Arquitectoma take responsibility for the damages of the housing complex located in Tlalpan 550. [size=no report]

On 3 May 2018, in Iztapalapa, Ciudad de Mexico, Distrito Federal, four people were shot and killed, and another was shot an injured by an unidentified number of armed people in Ampliacion El Triunfo neighbourhood. Allegedly the clash is related to a possible settling of scores between the Cartel de Tlahuac and the Los Rodolfos de Xochimilco. 4 fatalities.

On 3 May 2018, the body of a police patroller was found in the Colonia Jardines del Llano settlement in Tlahuac. He was last seen on 02 May as he finished his shift. His body bore head wounds. 1 fatality.

On 2 May 2018, the dead bodies of two minors were found in Xochimilco (Ciudad de Mexico). They had been shot in the head and their bodies were positioned in a way that seemed to attempt to send a message (they were wearing a t-shirt covering their mouth and neck). 2 fatalities.

Around 2 May 2018, there was a protest in Iztapalapa (Ciudad de Mexico) against the construction of a shoping centre right next to a water treatment plant. Protesters claim the initiative would generate environmental damages. [size= no report]

On 1 May 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico (Distrito Federal), members of the Mexican stolen and missing children association (AMNRDAC) were demonstrating demanding the appearance of the missing children. No fatalities or injured were reported. [size=no report]

Around 1 May 2018 (as reported), in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, Distrito Federal, a man a killed and his body was found in Doctores neighbourhood. The corpse had a message written on it, signed by ''Union'' allegedly the attack could have been perpetrated by La Union Tepito. 1 fatality.

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Cuajimalpa de Morelos
notes: On 30 April 2018, PAN supporters were threatened by armed individuals to take away the campaign material they were distributing in Cuajimalpa de Morelos. No fatalities or casualties reported.

On 29 April 2018, three hit men, allegedly associated with the organised crime group Los Rodolfos, shot at five persons selling drugs in the Iztapalapa neighbourhood of the Ciudad de Mexico. Four of the civilians attacked, apparently belonging to the Cartel de Tlahuac, died in the shooting, whereas a fourth person was severely hurt and sent to hospital. The incident allegedly occurred as part of Los Rodolfos' effort to seize the selling points and route left vacant after the killing of the leader of the Cartel de Tlahuac. 4 fatalities.

Around 29 April 2018 (as reported), in Benito Juarez district (Ciudad de Mexico), an armed group attempted to get hold of a property by attacking the two men who were guarding it. One of the guards was injured with a knife. The police made a total of 38 arrests and seized two vehicles.

On 29 April 2018, a man was shot dead in Iztapalapa (Ciudad de Mexico) by two unidentified gunmen. No information regarding the reason for the attack, or the identity of either the victim or the perpetrators. 1 fatality.

On 29 April 2018, the Morena candidate to mayor of district Alvaro Obregon, in Ciudad de Mexico, was joined by about 25 protesters and they proceeded to block avenue Vasco de Quiroga, right in front of a military headquarters (Campo Militar 1F). The block lasted about 25 minutes and the protesters allegedly insulted the Military Forces present there. [size= 25]

On 28 April 2018, around 15 protesters blocked the road on Dr. Martinez del Rio in Colonia Doctores, Cuauhtemoc Distrct (Ciudad de Mexico). They demanded the removal of a group of campers who are members of a group called ''Barzon Popular'' (Social Movement run by a community of farmers) and have occupied a certain area for 11 months. [size= 15]

location: Ciudad de Mexico - Gustavo A. Madero
notes: On 28 April 2018, two men performed a drive-by shooting on two others who were on a motorcycle in Gustavo A. Madero (Ciudad de Mexico). They ran into them as they shot them, injuring one of them. They then chased the second individual and shot him dead. Two other people (a man and a woman) were also hurt by the gunshots. 3 casualties, 1 fatality.

On 26 April 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Alvaro Obregon, Distrito Federal, workers and close to 150 members of civil organizations, including Cerezo Committee, Struggle for Popular Emancipation (OLEP) and Mexico City University's Workers Union (SUTIEMS) staged a demonstration outside the capital Human Rights Commission against the unjustified dismissal of workers from the University Institute (IEMS). On 1 March 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Alvaro Obregon, Distrito Federal, members of the Mexican Alliance against Fracking staged a demonstration outside the National Hydro carburate Commission (CNH) offices against the new projects related to exploration and exploitation of hydro carburates. [size=no report]

On 1 March 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Alvaro Obregon, Distrito Federal, close to 100 neighbors of Los Reyes staged a demonstration outside the Housing for Workers National Fund Institute (INFONAVIT) demanding their houses to be inspected for potential damages caused from the earthquake of September 2017. [size=close to 100]

On 1 March 2018, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, teachers of long distance education programs of the Secretary of Education staged a demonstration to complain about the delays in payments. [size=no report]

On 1 March 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Coyoacan, Distrito Federal, a group of students of the Autonomous National University (UNAM) staged a demonstration outside the Dean's office building to demand more security measures in the university and to demand authorities to stop criminalizing the student community. [size=no report]

On 28 February 2018, in Tlalpan, Ciudad de Mexico, a policeman who was off-duty was atacked and while driving a car by 2 men who shot from another car (drive-by) in San Miguel Ajusco.The policeman died and the woman he was driving with was injured. 1 fatality.

On 28 February 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Cuauhtemoc, three people were attacked by several armed men in Colonia Obrera. The victims were inside a parked car when several armed men on motorcycles arrived and opened fire (drive-by). Two of them died on the spot and one was wounded. Four attackers were arrested moments later by the Police. 2 fatalities, 1 injured.

On 28 February 2018, in the Alvaro Obregon delegation area (Mexico City), workers for the Secretary of Culture protested outside the building of the secretary to demand the respect of their working rights. [size=no report]

On 28 February 2018, in Cuauhtemoc, Ciudad de Mexico, two persons were killed and seven injured after unidentified armed men in a car and on a motorbike attacked them in a drive-by shooting in Buenos Aires neighbourhood. 2 fatalities.

On 27 February 2018, in Ciudad de Mexico-Coyoacan, Distrito Federal, a group of students of Reino de Jordania school and their parents staged a demonstration by blocking Universidad avenue to demand authorities to fix the sewer system in the sector that have caused problems in their school. [size=no report]
On 27 February 2018, at Jardines del Pedregal in the Alvaro Obregon area (Mexico City), local residents blocked a street in protest for more security and better public services. [size=no report]

Around 27 February 2018 (as reported), in Alvaro Obregon, Mexico City, a man was killed and his body was found with his hands-tied and two gunshot wounds in his head on Lomas de Tarango street. He was a famous DJ. 1 fatality.
